questions.text: A 31y P1L1 visit on her 7th postnatal day following a vaginal delivery. She had gestational diabetes but otherwise her delivery was uncomplicated. She complains of bilateral nipple soreness when breastfeeding which has worsened. She is afebrile. Both the nipples have open, bloody linear abrasions. The breasts are diffusely engorged and mildly tender on palpation. There are no palpable masses. What is the most possible etiology of her problem?

options.label: B
options.text: Candida infection from the infant’s oral cavity

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperglycemia leading to mastitis and engorgement

options.label: D
options.text: Poor and incorrect latching by the infant

questions.correct_answer: D. Poor and incorrect latching by the infant
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Poor and incorrect latching by the infant

questions.text: A 46y woman presents with a vaginal prolapse since a year and this has worsened since a few months. The gynecologist has made a grid which has the following mentioned data. What do the “+” and “-” sign in the grid denote?

options.label: A
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is distal to the hymen

options.label: B
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

options.label: C
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is proximal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is distal to the introital opening

options.label: D
options.text: “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the introital opening while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the introital opening

questions.correct_answer: B. “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen
questions.explanation: Ans. B) “+” denotes the prolapse is distal to the hymen while “-” denotes the point is proximal to the hymen

questions.text: Match the deformity with the corrective surgery needed:

A 27-year-old P2L2 teacher comes for contraceptive counselling. She has been using condoms but now wants something more long acting. She has regular periods lasting for 6 days and she uses the menstrual cup for the same but sometimes has to use additional pads also. She has been recently diagnosed with varicose veins in her legs but has no personal history of thrombo-embolism. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. Her vital signs are normal. Pelvic examination is normal. Which of the following is the most appropriate contraceptive choice?

A 35y G4 presents to the OPD with a missed period of 2 months. A pregnancy test at home is positive. She complains of nausea and mild abdominal pain. An ultrasound is ordered which shows the following. Which is most likely?

A 35y old woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is a primigravida and this is her 1st visit. She is currently 12 weeks. She has occasional nausea but is otherwise well. On examination her BP is 142/96 mmHg, and repeat measurement is 138/90mmHg. A urine dipstick is negative for proteins, She is asked to return after a week for BP measurement and her BP is 150/90 mmHg. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 23y primigravida presents to the gyn OPD. She is 10 weeks pregnant. She has no nausea or vomiting and is comfortable. A TVS shows the following image. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 24y primi presents to the gyn OPD. This is her first pregnancy, and she has missed her period by 2 days. Her cycles were previously regular. She reports no abnormal symptoms but is very anxious when asked to get the ultrasound after 2 weeks. She insists for an ultrasound now. What is the likely finding on ultrasound?

A 14y old girl visits the OPD with her mother. Her mother is anxious that she hasn’t achieved menarche yet. She says her elder daughter attained menarche at the age of 12y. The girl is doing well at school and enjoys sports. On examination, there is Tanner stage 3 breast development and pubic hair and axillary hair are present. What is the next best step?

A 23y primigravida presents to the labor room. She is 38 weeks pregnant and has so far had an uneventful pregnancy with regular antenatal checks. She has been experiencing pains since a few hours that are increasing in intensity and duration. On examination, her PR is 78/ min, BP is 110/70 mm Hg. Abdominal exam reveals a term uterus with 2 contractions lasting 15 seconds in 10 mins of mild intensity. The fetal heart rate is 140 bpm. Vaginal exam reveals the cervix is 2 cm dilated, 2 cm long, soft and mid-position. She is anxious and asks what would be the next course of action?

A 24y primigravida presents for her 1st ANC at 12 weeks. Her BMI is 17.5. She has been started on iron and calcium supplements and her appetite is good. On examination the uterus is just palpable. Which complication is she at risk of?
Endocrinological changes occurring during menopause include all except:
In following which statement is false:

options.label: A
options.text: At birth the uterine body and the cervix ratio is about 1:2

options.label: B
options.text: When menarche occurs the ratio between uterine body and the cervix becomes 1:1

options.label: C
options.text: After menarche, the ratio between uterine body and cervix becomes 2:1

questions.correct_answer: D. After menopause, the ratio remains 3:1
questions.explanation: Ans. D) After menopause, the ratio remains 3:1

questions.text: Absence of semen formation is known as:

Which is incorrect regarding AMH?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-Müllerian Hormone (AMH) is critical for physiologic involution of the Mullerian ducts during sexual differentiation in the male fetus

options.label: B
options.text: In women, AMH is a product of the small antral follicles in the ovaries and serves to function as an autocrine and paracrine regulator of follicular maturation

options.label: C
options.text: AMH is clinically useful as a screening tool for diminished ovarian reserve

options.label: D
options.text: A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.correct_answer: D. A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A low AMH is good predictor of development of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

questions.text: Which is true regarding Swyer syndrome:
questions.correct_answer: C. Pregnancy possible with donor oocyte
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Pregnancy possible with donor oocyte

questions.text: 34 weeks G2P1L1 pregnant lady complains of bleeding PV since 4 hours. Hb 6gm%, BP-90/60 mm Hg, P/A- FHS absent & uterus tonically contracted & deranged DIC profile. As per Page’s classification this is what grade of abruption?
A 45-year-old postmenopausal woman with bleeding has 8 mm thickness of endometrium. Next line of management is:
A 25-year-old female presents with history of 3 recurrent abortions. The most relevant test for identifying the cause is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Dilute Russell’s viper venom time
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Dilute Russell’s viper venom time

questions.text: A 28-year-old primigravida with 33 weeks of pregnancy suddenly complains of headache, oliguria, and blurred vision. Her BP is 180/110 mm Hg and urine albumin is +3. The next best thing to be done is:
Which is not an indication of intrauterine insemination except:
In stage II cervical cancer:

options.label: A
options.text: Carcinoma is strictly confined to the cervix

options.label: B
options.text: The carcinoma extends to the upper vagina or parametrium but not to the pelvic wall

options.label: C
options.text: The carcinoma has extended to the entire vagina

options.label: D
options.text: The carcinoma has extended to the pelvic side wall

questions.correct_answer: B. The carcinoma extends to the upper vagina or parametrium but not to the pelvic wall
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The carcinoma extends to the upper vagina or parametrium but not to the pelvic wall

questions.text: A 21y G2 is diagnosed to have FGR at 32 weeks. This is her umbilical artery doppler. What is the next best step:

options.label: C
options.text: Corticosteroids followed by induction of labor

questions.correct_answer: D. Weekly Doppler of umbilical artery
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Weekly Doppler of umbilical artery

options.label: B

questions.text: A 26y woman who is undergoing evaluation for infertility presents with this HSG film, done on day 8 of her periods. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat HSG after a course of antibiotics.

questions.text: 24y primi is in labor. During 2nd stage, fetal distress is seen. All the following are pre-requisites for this except:

options.label: A
options.text: The fetal scalp is seen at the perineum without separating the labia

options.label: B
options.text: The cervix is atleast 9 cm dilated

options.label: C
options.text: The fetal skull has reached the pelvic floor

options.label: D
options.text: The occiput lies under the pubic symohysis

questions.correct_answer: B. The cervix is atleast 9 cm dilated
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The cervix is atleast 9 cm dilated

questions.text: The instrument shown below is placed at the flexion point on the fetal scalp. Where is this point located?
questions.correct_answer: A. Anterior to the posterior fontanelle
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Anterior to the posterior fontanelle

questions.text: Which of the following abnormalities can be diagnosed in the 1st trimester of pregnancy?

questions.correct_answer: D. Twin to twin transfusion syndrome
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Twin to twin transfusion syndrome

questions.text: Following delivery of a 24y G2, you note the following. What complication was this patient at risk of if detected antenatally?

A 32y G5 presents in labor after an attempted home delivery by a dai. On examination she is dehydrated and appears exhausted. Her PR is 120/min, BP is 110/70 mm Hg. Abdominal exam reveals a term uterus which is tense and contracted. The fetal heart rate is absent. Vaginal exam reveals a 5 cm dilated cervix with a grid iron feel of the presenting part. Wat is the likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: A. Neglected shoulder with obstructed labor
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Neglected shoulder with obstructed labor

questions.text: The following image shows a test which is being developed for use in rapid identification of which obstetric complication?
A 27y woman approaches the clinic for HPV testing for cervical cancer screening. The HPV is positive for type 18 HPV. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Acyclovir and review after 6 weeks for a repeat test

options.label: B
options.text: Enhancing operative outcomes in gynecological surgeries

Her PR is 110/ min and BP is 100/60 mm Hg. The uterus is flabby. Vaginal examination reveals excessive bleeding with passage of clots. Uterine massage is commenced along with IV oxytocin infusion but the bleeding continues. She is catheterized, crystalloids are infused, and help is called for. questions.explanation: Ans. B) The fallopian tubes are patent

questions.text: A 45y woman presents with foul smelling vaginal discharge and inter-menstrual bleeding. On examination, a growth arising from the cervix is seen and biopsy reveals a squamous cell carcinoma. The growth appears limited to the cervix and is 2 cm in size. There is no parametrial or vaginal involvement. The next best step is?

options.label: A
options.text: Radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymph node dissection

options.label: B
options.text: Extra fascial hysterectomy with sentinel lymph node biopsy

options.text: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy followed by radical hysterectomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymph node dissection
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymph node dissection

options.text: Uterine anomaly with distortion of the uterine cavity

questions.explanation: Ans. D) Uterine anomaly with distortion of the uterine cavity

questions.text: Your 32-year-old patient has no complaints when presenting for a routine health maintenance visit but is found to have a clinically abnormal vaginal discharge during speculum examination of the vagina. questions.explanation: Ans. C) Cancer antigen 19-9 (CA19-9)—mucinous epithelial ovarian carcinoma

questions.text: A 14-year-old female presents with increasingly painful, cyclic menses since menarche 9 months ago. Oral analgesics and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medications no longer adequately control her dysmenorrhea. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?

Which of the following is the most appropriate procedure for further diagnosis and/or treatment?

A 25y primigravida presents to the OPD with a history of a dog bite. Her neighbor’s pet dog has bit her on the leg. She is currently 14 weeks pregnant. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Clean the wound, administer only tetanus vaccine

questions.correct_answer: A. Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Clean the wound, administer tetanus and rabies vaccine

Identify the position:

A 36y woman presents to the gyn OPD with secondary amenorrhoea. She has 1 child who is 8 years old, and she had a surgical termination of pregnancy done a year earlier. She says her mother attained menopause in her late thirties. Examination reveals a normal sized uterus, and no adnexal mass is palpable. Her pregnancy test is negative and her FSH is 6. What is the likely diagnosis?
As per the WHO Labor Care Guide, at what cervical dilatation should active phase begin?
A 24y is referred for colposcopy from the primary health center in view of a suspicious looking cervix for which the midwife has sent you the image shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 48y woman brings her 15y old daughter to the OPD. Her 65y old mother has been recently diagnosed with cervical cancer and she wants to enquire about the HPV vaccine for her and her daughter. What is the correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: HPV vaccine for both the woman and her daughter is advised

options.label: B
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

options.label: C
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to the woman

options.label: D
options.text: There is no role of the HPV vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter
questions.explanation: Ans. B) HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

questions.text: A primigravida with 36 wks gestation is admitted with history of preeclampsia, pain abdomen and bleeding per vaginum. On examination pulse rate is 96/min and BP 130/90 mm Hg, uterus is tonically contracted, fetal heart sounds are absent, fetal head is engaged, and pelvic examination shows dark red blood-stained liquor, and cervix is 4 cms dilated. Hb is 8 g% and coagulation profile is normal. Blood has been arranged. The further plan of management should be:

options.label: A
options.text: Fetal monitoring with CTG and expectant management till term.

questions.correct_answer: C. Augmentation of labour with oxytocin
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Augmentation of labour with oxytocin

options.text: a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h

options.text: a, b, c, d, e, g, h

options.text: a, b, c, e, g, h

A 27y woman presents to the emergency with severe abdominal pain. She gives a history of amenorrhoea of 2 months. On examination, her PR is 110/min, BP is 90/60mmHg. There is guarding on abdominal examination. Vaginal exam reveals mild tenderness with spotting. The internal os is closed. Her UPT is positive. What is the next best step?

A 35y woman presents to the emergency with severe dysmenorrhoea not responding to NSAIDs. She gives a history of worsening dysmenorrhoea and also has pain when passing stools. She does not give a history of constipation. Her periods are otherwise regular. On bimanual examination, the uterus is fixed and retroverted. On further history, she reveals that she hasn’t conceived despite being married for 3 years for which she was planning to show the gynecologist. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 21y unmarried girl presents to the OPD with increasing weight gain and acne. On asking, she says her period are regular. On examination, her BMI is 28. An ultrasound reveals the following in 1 ovary. What is the best treatment option?

A 23y schoolteacher is 12 weeks pregnant. A child in her class develops chickenpox and she comes to the OPD as she has been exposed to the child. She does not give a history of ever having chicken pox in the past. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Urgent fetal medicine referral for a detailed ultrasound

questions.text: A 30y primi presents at 32 weeks for a routine checkup. On examination, the uterus is 28 weeks. The fetal parts are not easily palpable with the uterus appearing to grip the fetus, and the fetal heart rate is heard very clearly. An ultrasound is ordered. questions.correct_answer: A. Cannot be given in lactating women

You perform a dilatation and curettage (D&C) with no complications. A week later, you receive the pathology report for the evacuated products of conception: Specimen: uterine contents DNA interpretation by image cytometry: 69 XXY Immunostaining: p57KIP2 positive These histologic findings are consistent with which of the following diagnoses?

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding sexual differentiation in humans?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Without the influence of SRY, gonads develop as testes

questions.text: A G2P1 presents at 28 weeks. On examination, the uterus is 24 weeks. On ultrasound there is absent liquor. Which could be the most likely cause?

A 34y P1 has starting using the combined oral contraceptive pill for family planning. Since she is new to the method, she skipped 3 pills in the 1st 2 weeks and approaches the primary health center and asks if there is a possibility of pregnancy. What is your advice?

options.label: A
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining packet

options.label: B
options.text: Take the last 2 missed pills as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: C
options.text: Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

options.label: D

questions.explanation: Ans. C) Take the last missed pill as soon as possible, use an additional method for 7 days and take the emergency contraceptive pill

questions.text: A 28-year-old G3P2L2 woman presented to the antenatal OPD at 36 weeks of amenorrhea. Ultrasound shows that the fetus is in a transverse lie. The liquor is adequate, the placenta is normal, and she has no gross anomaly. Both her previous deliveries were normal vaginal deliveries. How will you manage this patient?
The most potent natural estrogen is :
An 18y girl with primary amenorrhoea presents to the OPD. She has Tanner stage IV secondary sexual characters. Her karyotype is 46XX. FHS is 5 mIU/mL and LH is 13 IU/L . What is the likely diagnosis?
A primigravida is in the 2nd stage of labor for 2 hours. The head is at +3 with caput present and there is FHR is dropping to 90bpm. What is the best way to deliver the head?
Dose of corticosteroids for lung maturity?
A patient with O negative and husband B positive delivered a baby. Has received anti-D prophylaxis at 28 weeks. In which of the following conditions will you give anti-D post delivery?
A 30y woman using Antara as a contraceptive is 15 days late as per her schedule. What is the next step?

options.label: C
options.text: Give DMPA with 7 days of barrier

questions.text: A G2 with a previous LSCS underwent cesarean delivery. During surgery there was excessive bleeding, and a hysterectomy had to be done. The image of the uterus is shown. What is the probable diagnosis?
IUCD can be inserted after delivery till?
By doing McRoberts's manuever, how many shoulder dystocias get resolved?
What is the appropriate management of vulvovaginal hematomas?

options.label: B
options.text: To prevent infection, they should all undergo ultrasound guided drainage

options.label: C
options.text: In a small hematoma, if pain is severe then ice packs and analgesia are appropriate

options.label: D
options.text: If bleeding ceases, small to moderate-sized hematomas can be treated expectantly.

questions.correct_answer: D. If bleeding ceases, small to moderate-sized hematomas can be treated expectantly.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) If bleeding ceases, small to moderate-sized hematomas can be treated expectantly.

questions.text: Ligation at which of the following labeled vessel points in the retroperitoneum will decrease the pulse pressure in the uterine artery?
The following picture unfortunately depicts a maternal death after delivery. What is the diagnosis?
A 24y P2 is having atonic PPH following delivery. What is the name of this instrument used in the management?

A 27-year-old multigravida tells you at her 28-week prenatal care visit that she shows interest in a tubal ligation after delivery. For which of the following reasons do encourage her to get the procedure done?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with a later age of menopause

options.label: B
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer

options.label: C
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of PID

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with a lower incidence of PCOS

questions.correct_answer: B. It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is associated with a lower incidence of ovarian cancer

questions.text: A 37-year-old underwent a bilateral tubal ligation 2 years ago at the time of her third cesarean section. She now presents with amenorrhea and nausea and vomiting for the last month. You perform a urine pregnancy test, and it is positive. You perform an ultrasound and discover the finding below at the right adnexa. It measures 4 cm and the beta hCG is 7000. What is the next best management option?

Ms. M is a 24-year-old recently engaged woman who presents to discuss contraceptive methods in advance of her wedding. She and her fiancé have not been sexually active and do not intend to be until after the wedding. She has no medical comorbidities and has a normal body mass index. She has always had irregular menstrual cycles ranging from 28 to 40 days. She is sure that they do not desire pregnancy for 1 to 2 years, and she has a religious objection to any method that has prevention of implantation of a fertilized embryo as a major mechanism of action. Taking all these factors into account, what is the most efficacious method you can recommend for this patient?
With use of the contraceptive method pictured, how frequently should it be replaced?
A 41-year-old G4P3 presents for fetal sonographic evaluation at 19 weeks’ gestation. The following image is obtained. What is the diagnosis?

You are augmenting a term patient who is attempting a vaginal birth after cesarean delivery. She is 6 cm dilated, 90% effaced, and –1 station and was comfortable with her epidural anesthesia when you checked her 10 minutes ago. You notice the heart rate tracing abnormalities that are pictured. You recheck the patient but can no longer feel the fetal head on PV. The maternal heart rate is 85 beats per minute, blood pressure 84/46 mmHg, and respirations 18 breaths per minute. What is the best intervention based on the findings?
Identify this uterine incision:
In all except which of the following presentations may forceps be used?
To resolve the complication shown in the image below, which of the following maneuvers should not be employed?

options.label: A
options.text: The fetus should be pulled downward to release the arm

options.label: B
options.text: The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise

options.label: C
options.text: The fetus is gently pushed upward back into the pelvis for second attempt at rotation if a primary maneuver is unsuccessful

questions.correct_answer: B. The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The fetus should be rotated 180 degrees clockwise and then counter-clockwise

questions.text: Based on the ultrasound findings shown in the image of a pregnant woman, you suspect the genetic studies to show?

options.label: D
options.text: Any of the above could be seen

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the umbilical artery Doppler shown below?

options.label: C
options.text: This finding is normal until 32 weeks’ gestation

options.label: D
options.text: This pattern indicates decreased resistance to umbilical artery blood flow.

questions.correct_answer: B. This is reversed end-diastolic flow
questions.explanation: Ans. B) This is reversed end-diastolic flow

questions.text: During a postpartum hysterectomy for intractable bleeding, a Heaney clamp is placed on the uterine artery near its insertion to the uterus. What is the relationship between the ureter and uterine artery at this point?

options.label: A
options.text: The ureter is 2 cm medial to the uterine artery at this location

options.label: B
options.text: The ureter is 2 cm medial to the uterine artery and crosses under it

options.label: C
options.text: The ureter is 2 cm lateral to the cervix and crosses over the uterine artery

options.label: D
options.text: The ureter is 2 cm lateral to the cervix and crosses under the uterine artery

questions.correct_answer: D. The ureter is 2 cm lateral to the cervix and crosses under the uterine artery
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The ureter is 2 cm lateral to the cervix and crosses under the uterine artery

questions.text: A 23y presents to the OPD with a concern that she is having a disturbance in the frequency of her menstrual cycles. A normal menstrual cycle has a frequency of?
